summary: Replimune stock cratered Tuesday after the Food and Drug Administration unexpectedly rejected its experimental melanoma treatment.

headline: JNJ Seeks FDA Approval for Oral Psoriasis Drug Icotrokinra

headline: Replimune Stock Plummets 75% After FDA Rejects Application for Skin Cancer Treatment
summary: Shares of  Replimune Group  cratered on Tuesday after the biotech said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration rejected an application seeking approval of its experimental skin cancer treatment.  While the FDA didn’t raise any safety issues, the agency indicated it wouldn’t be able to approve the application in its current form, Replimune said.  Shares fell 75% to $3.04, putting the stock on track for a record closing low, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

Shares fell 75% to $3.04, putting the stock on track for a record closing low, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q1 Earnings?
summary: Over the past six months, Bristol-Myers Squibb’s shares (currently trading at $46.80) have posted a disappointing 18% loss, well below the S&P 500’s 3.7% gain. This might have investors contemplating their next move.
